intro: Erigeron lyratus, commonly known as the lyrical fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its blue to purple flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Erigeron lyratus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
